avalancheActivity.comment: On January 3rd, the snowplow in Bláfjöll pushed a cornice which triggered a small slab avalanche.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted in warm weather the last few days. It should stiffen and gain even more strength when temperatures drop below 0°C.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It warmed up significantly in all elevations on Sunday and has been warm since. Snow has subsided and melted. Snow has decreased in mountains and is now presumably homogeneous and stable. The avalanche danger is considered low. Snow should stiffen and gain even more strength when temperatures drop below 0°C.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.

weatherForecast.highlights: Fremur úrkomulítið næstu daga. Kólnar smám saman á laugardag, frost á láglendi á sunnudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted in warm weather the last few days. Little snow is left in the area and the avalanche danger low.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It warmed up significantly in all elevations on Sunday and has been warm since. Snow has subsided and melted. Now, there is rather little snow left in the area and presumably homogeneous and stable. With dropping temperatures, the snow should stiffen and strengthen even further. The avalanche danger is considered low.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.

weatherForecast.highlights: Úrkomulítið næstu daga. Vestanátt á föstudag og kólnar til fjalla. Kólnar meira á laugardag, frost á láglendi um kvöldið og á sunnudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The snow has been settling in repeated melt-freeze cycles and is estimated stable

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.

weatherForecast.highlights: SV-læg átt og kólnar með snjókomu til fjalla og snýst í V-lægari átt með talsverður frosti um helgina

avalancheActivity.comment: Slab avalanches released in Lambeyrardalur above Eskifjörður and Bagall in of Norðfjörður on Monday, January 8th. The same day, multiple rather small loose avalanches released in the area. A few dry slab avalanches released in SW aspects in Eskifjörður and Fagridalur the night before January 5th.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided in warm weather and partly melted away. It should widely have become stiff and rather stable. In the highest mountains, weaknesses can still exist.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It got warm up to mountain tops on Sunday and Monday and then, snow subsided and partly melted. Multiple avalanches released during this temperature change. After this thaw, snow should widely have become stiff and rather stable. In the highest mountains, where the effect of the thaw has been less, there is more snow and a possibility for a deeper weakness. At these high elevations, avalanches can become large if they release.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has settled and melted significantly in repeated melt-freeze cycles in the last days. The stability is considered good most places.

weatherForecast.highlights: Kólnar smám saman á föstudag. Talsverð frost um helgina og lítilsháttar él.
